meanings.definition: Climb awkwardly or with difficulty, using both hands and feet.
meanings.sent1: The little kitten was clambering up the tree to chase a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were clambering up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was clambering up the bird feeder to steal some seeds.
meanings.sent4: The vines were clambering up the old brick wall, reaching for the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The children were clambering up the jungle gym, laughing and playing.

meanings.definition: Move in a climbing motion with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: The spider was clambering up the drainpipe to reach its web.
meanings.sent2: The exhausted climber was clambering up the final stretch of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was clambering up the garbage can to find a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The ivy was clambering up the side of the house, slowly covering the walls.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar was clambering up the stem of the flower, eager to reach the petals.
